data.name: SurveyOptionsHelp
data.value:
Survey Settings: New Survey and Settings

The Settings options are used to setup and customize the survey's general behaviour:

New Survey

* Title
This is used mainly as logical information to distinguish one survey from the other in the administration tool. Its not used or shown on the survey control seen by the survey respondents.

Settings

* Opening Date
This is the date as of which the survey will accept new entries. No entries will be accepted before that date. Leave blank if the survey has no particular opening date.

* Active
This feature sets the SurveyID on the web control to -1. Once the SurveyID property is set to -1 the webcontrol will automatically take and use the activated survey in the database. There can be only one activated survey at one time. This way a survey can be changed any time without having to change the survey id from the page on which the web control code is added.

* Closing Date
This is the date at which the survey will close and not accept any more entries. Leave blank if the survey has no deadline or a particular closing date.

* Footer Progress Display
This determines what will be shown in the survey control footer. The choices are to show nothing or to show specific information on the current progress by selecting page numbers or percentage progress.

* Disable Questions Numbering
Check this if the current question number on the left of each question in the survey control should not be shown.

* Scored
This can be enabled in order to specify a score for each answer and then see the scores for each respondent. More information at: Score Introduction.

* Previous / Next Page Navigation
This allows the user to navigate back and forth in the survey's pages while answering questions. By default the user can only move forward in the survey and cannot come back to change answers.

* Resume Of Progress
This allows the user to save current answers and resume the survey at a later stage. We can either choose to save the unique code provided by Key Provider in the destination storage of the key provider. By default the Survey key provider's destination storage is a cookie, so when the respondent comes back he will not need to enter any code manually. The drawback of this approach is that he will need to resume the survey on the same computer when he saved the progress on. We an also set the resume to manually, in this case a unique code will be provided as a text message on screen and he will be able to resume at any time and from anywhere and continue answering the survey by clicking the resume progress button.

* Delete Button
This will delete a survey and all it's questions, answers and respondent answers. It is not possible to recover a survey once it has been deleted.

* Clone Button
This will create a full copy of the survey settings and content (questions, answertypes etc.). The respondent answers are not copied to the cloned survey.

* Xml Export Button
This will export the survey in XML in order to (re-)import it at a later time or on another Survey installation. For example a series of surveys could be created on a test server, exported and re-imported on a production server.

data.name: NotificationsSettingsHelp
data.value:
The email notification features make it possible to receive an email message each time a new user has filled out a survey. Three types of notifications are available:

* Short Message will send an email with a brief text stating that a new person has posted answers to the survey .
* Full Entry will send a complete report where all respondent's answers will be shown including those that were not answered.
* Answers Only will send a partial report where only respondent's answers will be shown.

Once the preferred notification type is chosen further (email)settings are shown:

* Email From: the email address from which the notification will be send.
* Email Notification To: the email address that will receive the notification.
* Email Notification Subject: the subject of the notification email.

Before using the email Notification options make sure that the (SMTP) mail server is setup correctly. Either during the installation or after by checking the web.config file "mail server settings" in the SurveySetting section.

data.name: HelpFilesText
data.value:
- Integrated helpfiles are part of the Survey Project webapplication:

o An index of helpfiles is available at menu Help/ Helpfiles.
o Tooltip [blue questionmark] icons linked to particular helptexts and subjects can be found on different webpages of the webapplication

- Visit the Forums section of the Community website to ask any questions or share information and experiences on the use and development of SP.

- A contact form is availabe if more private contact is required. Emails can be send to: mail@surveyproject.org

- At the Survey project YouTube Channel instruction movies are published on the installation and use of SP.

- Technical information, downloads and sources can be found at https://www.github.com/surveyproject.

data.name: StartupSettings
data.value:
- On first starting the webapplication an initial administrator account is created from the username / password entered into the login textboxes. The password is saved to the database encrypted and cannot be recovered if lost or forgotten.

- Several technical settings of the application can be changed by admins throught the System Settings Menu. Background information can be found in the System Settings Helpfile.

- Survey Samples: sample survey xml files are part of the Survey package [directory: _SurveySamples]. They can be imported after logging in [new survey / import survey from XML] and will give a good first impression of the different features of SP.

- The language settings of the webbrowser used to access SP determine which xml languagefiles are used to present webpage texts. This is regulated by one of the settings in the web.config file: culture/ uiculture. If set to "auto" (2x) SP will pick up the culture/ language of your browsersettings. To explicitely pick a specific culture/ language, replace "auto" with "en-US" or "nl-NL" for example.

data.name: SettingsTitleHelp
data.value: Title: The title is used as logical information to distinguish one survey from the other in the administration tool. It is not used or shown on the survey control as seen by the survey respondents. The default mailmessage to invite survey takers does show the title initially. It can be edited at will.

data.name: SettingsOpeningDateHelp
data.value: Opening Date: This is the date as of which the survey will accept new entries. No entries will be accepted before that date and a message is shown when someone tries to acces the survey before the opening date. Leave blank if the survey has no particular opening date.

data.name: SettingsCloseDateHelp
data.value: Closing Date: This is the date at which the survey will close and not accept any more entries. No entries will be accepted after that date and a message is shown when someone tries to acces the survey after the closing date. Leave blank if the survey has no deadline or a particular closing date.

data.name: SettingsProgressHelp
data.value: Footer Progress Display: This option determines what will be shown in the survey control footer to indicate progress while answering the survey. The choices are to show nothing or to show specific information on the current progress by selecting page numbers or percentage progress.

data.name: SettingsQnumberingHelp
data.value: Disable Questions Numbering: Check this option if the current question number on the left of each question in the survey control should not be shown.

data.name: SettingsActiveHelp
data.value: Active: With this option the survey will be activated so respondents will be able to access and take the survey. A message is shown to survey takers when the survey is accessed while it is not activated. The Active option always has to be set before publishing a survey. Otherwise access will not be possible.

data.name: SettingsDefaultHelp
data.value: Default: This option can only be set by administrators. It allows to set a default survey that will be automatically be selected if no other survey is selected from the survey treelist directory. If a default survey is set and no survey is selected from the treelist directory on selecting a menuoption (e.g. formbuilder) that would otherwise require a selected survey from the treelist directory now the default survey will be opened and no warning message is shown.

data.name: SettingsScoredHelp
data.value: Scored: This option has to be enabled in order to be able to specify a score for each answer on answerlevel and then see the scores for each respondent in the results.

data.name: SettingsNavigationHelp
data.value: Navigation: This option will allow the user to navigate back and forth in the survey's pages while answering questions. By default the user can only move forward in the survey and can not go back to change answers.

data.name: SettingsResumeHelp
data.value: Resume: This option will allow a user to save current answers and resume the survey at a later moment by providing a unique code.

data.name: SliderValue
data.value: Default Value: Sets the default position (value = signed integer) of slider on the bar (between min and max value).

data.name: SliderMinValue
data.value: Minimum Value: Minimum slider bar value (signed integer) to select.

data.name: SliderMaxValue
data.value: Maximum Value: Maximum slider bar value (signed integer) to select.

data.name: SliderRangeValue
data.value: Minimum/ Maximum Range: Options to set the starting point of sliderbar greyscale: a. minimum value = grey sliderbar start from mimimum side; b. maximum value = grey sliderbar starts from maximum side; c. no value = no grey bar on either side (min. or max.).

data.name: SliderAnimateValue
data.value: Animate Value: Option to set the animate feature of the sliderbar. If set the sliderbar if clicked will glide towards the clicked point on the bar.

data.name: SliderStepValue
data.value: Step Value: Option to set the steps value (signed integers only). The steps value determines the size of the increments with which the slider moves along the bar if clicked.

data.name: RequiredMarkerSettings
data.value: Required Markers Check the helpfiles section "Survey Designer and Form Builder" for a complete explanation of how to use and set "Required Markers" by making use of the Minimum Selection Required setting (Question level) or the Mandatory checkbox (Answer level).
